channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11733] Avoid copy-paste in Master/Region CoprocessorHost
item.description:
all the methods of MasterCoprocessorHost and RegionCoprocessorHost are copy-paste, and a couple of them have some missing fixes.
The body of each function is the same, the only difference is the call to the specific coprocessor.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I have etracted the common code in a execOperation() method, and now each one of the pre/post method have only to implement something like this:


public boolean preCreateNamespace(final NamespaceDescriptor ns) throws IOException {

  return execOperation(new CoprocessorOperation() {

    @Override

    public void call(MasterObserver oserver, ObserverContext<MasterCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx)

        throws IOException {

      oserver.preCreateNamespace(ctx, ns);

    }

  });

}



public RegionScanner preScannerOpen(final Scan scan) throws IOException {

  final ObjectReference<RegionScanner> res = new ObjectReference<RegionScanner>(null);

  boolean bypass = execOperation(new RegionOperation() {

    @Override

    public void call(RegionObserver oserver, ObserverContext<RegionCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx)

        throws IOException {

      res.set(oserver.preScannerOpen(ctx, scan, res.get()));

    }

  });

  return bypass ? res.get() : null;

}

This message is automatically generated.
That's a nice refactor. Would you be willing to do this for 0.98+? Or someone else could backport...

Nice!

Could this have performance implications, especially for hooks into hot paths like preScannerNext(...), etc. We're creating one more object upon each invocation now.

Could this have performance implications, especially for hooks into hot paths like preScannerNext(...), etc. We're creating one more object upon each invocation now.

correct, the other alternative that I had in mind was to use reflection and have something like execOperation("preCreate", arg1, arg2) so you avoid the interface creation/scope-capture but you have reflection and strings around.

the problem is that the CoprocessorHost is sort of unmaintainable, if you look at the code you have some method with slightly variations and some fix not applied. Do you have other suggestions?

This message is automatically generated.

I tend to agree with Matteo that the maintainability improvement is really big here. The copy-paste wasn't bad in the beginning but the pre/post-amble of coprocessor hook invocations has grown over time, and inconsistently (bad)

Use of reflection will cost us more than an additional object allocation, guaranteed.

Thanks for the 0.98 patch. +1 for 0.98 and up

yeah just to follow up with some numbers, reflection is too expensive while the new Interface() takes only few nanoseconds per call. I've tested it with jit disabled calling the direct method vs calling a method with the interface that calls the direct method.. and by dividing the total time by the numbers of call I'm around 20nanosec.

In the initial coprocessor development, we were hesitant to do something similar and introduce any additional overhead in hot code paths. But I agree that the current code has grown unmaintainable, and this would be a really nice clean up to have.

If we can show there is no significant impact on performance or GC, then a big +1. Do you have any sense of the difference in young gen GC pre and post change?

ok, instead of going in this discussion is the extra allocation costing more..
I'll propose another change, which will result in the same number of allocations.

We already allocate 1 object, which is the ObserverContext
if the CoprocessorOperation extends the ObserverContext, you have 1 allocations that does both.
if we want to push also for the coprocessor list may be empty and in the old code we avoided the allocation we can also do: coprocessors.isEmpty() ? null : new CoprocessorOperation()


public void preCreateTable(final HTableDescriptor htd, final HRegionInfo[] regions)

    throws IOException {

  execOperation(coprocessors.isEmpty() ? null : new CoprocessorOperation() {

    @Override

    public void call(MasterObserver oserver, ObserverContext<MasterCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx)

        throws IOException {

      oserver.preCreateTable(ctx, htd, regions);

    }

  });

}

thoughts?

This message is automatically generated.

We already allocate 1 object, which is the ObserverContext. if the CoprocessorOperation extends the ObserverContext, you have 1 allocations that does both.

So in the v2 patch execOperation looks like:


   private boolean execOperation(final CoprocessorOperation ctx) throws IOException {

     boolean bypass = false;

     for (RegionServerEnvironment env: coprocessors) {

       if (env.getInstance() instanceof RegionServerObserver) {

        ctx.prepare(env);

         Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();

         ClassLoader cl = currentThread.getContextClassLoader();

         try {

           currentThread.setContextClassLoader(env.getClassLoader());

           ctx.call((RegionServerObserver)env.getInstance(), ctx);

         } catch (Throwable e) {

           handleCoprocessorThrowable(env, e);

         } finally {

           currentThread.setContextClassLoader(cl);

         }

         bypass |= ctx.shouldBypass();

         if (ctx.shouldComplete()) {

           break;

         }

       }

       ctx.postEnvCall(env);

     }

     return bypass;

   }

IMO, this is better. It doesn't look bad, and we will save a bit on young collection workload

if we want to push also for the coprocessor list may be empty and in the old code we avoided the allocation we can also do: coprocessors.isEmpty() ? null : new CoprocessorOperation()

Also sounds like a good idea.

execOperation(coprocessors.isEmpty() ? null : new CoprocessorOperation()

+1 on that. Normally this would not even be an issue except for tight loop hooks that hook into scanner.next(), etc.

+1 on committing with this check in place.
+1 on v2 plus additional coprocessors.isEmpty() check. This will be a net gain when no coprocessors are installed (no iterator instantiated) and we get the added maintainability for free. Nice work!
